name: "Brian Goes Back to College" Quiz | 'Family Guy'- Season 4 | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the beginning of the episode, Peter and the guys go to a TV convention.  What decade is the convention focused on?
questions.explanation:
The eighties.

	For the convention, Peter, Quagmire, Joe, and Cleveland each dress up as a different member of "The A-Team".  "The A-Team" premiered in 1983 and lasted five seasons.  At the convention, the guys won a contest for the best group costumes.

questions.text: What body spray did Peter once try?
questions.explanation:
Tag.

	In original commercials for Tag body spray, a guy would spray the deodorant on in the store and women would fight to get him.  There's a different result when Peter tries it on.  Instead of women coming after him, Peter is surrounded by sick cats.

questions.text: What is one thing that Brian isn't offered at the New Yorker office?
questions.explanation:
Biscuits.

	After Brian writes a good review for the Quahog Daily Shopper, he is called by the editor of the "New Yorker", Wellesley Shepperton.  When Brian is offered a job, he decides to take it, but he is fired when the editor finds out that Brian didn't finish his courses at Brown University and never graduated.

questions.text: Which actor filled in for Stewie when he went to college?
questions.explanation:
Gary Coleman.

	When Brian decides to get his final college course completed, Stewie manages to tag along by stowing away in Brian's bag.  Meanwhile, Lois has no idea that Stewie is gone because Stewie hired Gary Coleman to be his replacement.

questions.text: What is the name of the roommate that Brian was supposed to have?
questions.explanation:
Caleb.

	Caleb is a freaky goth guy who says that he likes to cut himself.  Stewie manages to scare Caleb away by pretending that he and Brian are roommates.  Although Stewie doesn't actually do any schoolwork at the university, he manages to become well-known around the campus.

questions.text: What course does Brian need to finish at university?
questions.explanation:
Advanced Physics.

	Although Brian has a very tough time in his class (partly because of the stress of an early test), he manages to make it as the teacher's star pupil.  Unfortunately, Brian cheated on his first assignment because Stewie gave him the correct answers.

questions.text: What does Stewie name the picture that he buys for Brian's dorm room?
questions.explanation:
Crazy Stairs.

	Stewie buys "Crazy Stairs" in the school shop and hangs it on the wall in Brian's dorm room to spruce up the place.  Shortly after hanging it up, Stewie goes outside to play Ultimate Frisbee and accidentally throws the Frisbee through the window and hits the picture.

questions.text: According to this episode, what song did Ashlee Simpson try lip-syncing to on "Saturday Night Live"?
questions.explanation:
Old Man River.

	When Ashlee Simpson attempts to sing to "Old Man River", a deep male voice ends up singing the song, and she has no choice but to dance and run off the stage.  Many people remember when Ashlee Simpson lip-synced on "Saturday Night Live", but she was actually singing a song from her debut album, "Autobiography".

questions.text: What is the name of Meg's fake boyfriend in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Darren Mitchellstork.

	According to Meg, he is the Chairman of the Soccer Ball Organization.  When Meg and Lois watch a news story about the demolition of Roger Williams Memorial Park, Meg says that she and Darren go there all the time.  Lois doesn't buy into this and mocks her.

questions.text: Does Brian pass his final exam?
questions.explanation:
No.

	After talking with Lois and nearly chickening out at the last second, Brian decides to take his final exam (with some study help from Stewie).  After the exam, he tells the family that he failed, and although the family thinks that he's a weirdo for not being disappointed or angry, he says that he has pride in the fact that he didn't decide to crack under the pressure.
